Sent.resendAlertResendEveryoneHasnotAcknowled: Resend to everyone who hasn't acknowledged it before

SendUser.chooseRecipient&Send: Step 2 of 2: just choose recipients and send
SendUser.selectBroadcast: Caution: sending the content via Broadcast will deliver it to every User/Group/Computer/Organizational Unit within your policy. Please note the following:
SendUser.broadcastAlertRecieve: 1. If the alert is received by a Computer, it is immediately stored for all users working on it. So, if you want to send the message only to users currently online, sending to Computers (or by Broadcast) is not a good idea.
SendUser.broadcastEmailDeliver: 2. Emails (SMS messages) are delivered to any users with email addresses (phone numbers) specified, even if they do not have 2b Innovations clients. This may lead to the license limit exceeding and/or additional costs (in SMS messages case).

CreateScreensaver.screensaverContentOptForUploadFile: 4.Use the button below and upload the file you just saved
CreateScreensaver.numberOfSecondsToDisplay: The number of seconds to display screensaver before switch to next active screensaver
CreateScreensaver.optionForStart&EndDate&Time: Start and end date and time
CreateScreensaver.screensaverVideo: Only a limited selection of video formats can be played on a Windows screensaver. It is recommended to convert your video to .wmvformat prior to uploading it. You can use any free on-line video converter for this matter.

Domains.domainsADFilter: Add a group based on AD Filter

DomainsFilter.dateFormat: 3.USers who have a birthday in January 2020 (attribute 'whenCreated' has type 'DirectoryString' and format 'YYYY/MM/DD') (&(objectClass=user)(birthday=202/01/*))
DomainsFilter.adFilterEnter: Enter AD filter for group building

CreateSynchronization.synchronizingProcess: Please note that the synchronizing process may take some time(up to severalhours) depending on the number of groups selected and number of users in domains.
CreateSynchronization.synchronizationAllOrgUnits: Synchronize all Organizational Units(users and groups will be selected from whole Domain tree)
CreateSynchronization.synchronizationSelectedOrgUnits: Synchronize selected Organizational Units(only users and groups from selected OU's will be synchronized)
CreateSynchronization.notSynchronizeOrgUnits: Don't Synchronize Organizational Units(users and groups will be synchronized from the Domain without OU's)
CreateSynchronization.synchronizeSelectedGroup_Users: Synchronize selected groups and users from them
CreateSynchronization.uncheckedItemsAdd: If unchecked will only add new items without removal
CreateSynchronization.SynchronizationTakeTime: Please note that the synchronizing process may take some time (up to severalhours) depending on the number of groups selected and number of users in domains.

CreatePolicies.listSendNotificationsRecipient: Can send notifications to specified recipients only

CreatePolicies.TemplateViewSelfCreatedContent: Publisher can view only self created Alert Template

Approval.reasonOfRejection: Enter reason of rejection in the field below.

Settings.consoleControlPanel: Changes will apply after full control Panel page refresh
Settings.sendAllUserDevices: Send to all user devices always
Settings.afterConfirmation: Do not send after first confirmation
Settings.activeDirectoryClientApp: Client applications installed on non-domain devices will request end user credentials which are not verified against the AD domain. If specified username is not found in 2b Innovations - new user is registered
Settings.SMSDefaultAddress: SMS default phone (Use country code without +)
Settings.gatewaySmsText: Use %smsText % in place where your sms text should be.
Settings.gatewayRecipientNumber: Use %mobilePhone% in place where your recipient number should be.
Settings.singlePublisherSession: The maximum numebr of sessions for a single publisher can not exceed the maximum number of sessions for the entire server.
Settings.daysToKeepLog: Number of days to keep logs:
Settings.passwordExpiryDays: After how many days should password expire?
Settings.passwordChange: After how many days ask to change password?
Settings.publisherLockedOut: Minutes to keep the publisher locked out
Settings.passwordrecoveryFeature: Enable Password recovery feature on login
Settings.publisherTimeZone: Allow publishers to configure time zone preferences
Settings.inboundRepeatTask: Repeating a task in minutes (not less than 5)
Settings.inboundAllowedAddress: Allowed addresses from which messages are processed
Settings.optUnsubscribeLink: Use %unsubscribe Link% as placeholder for unsubscribe link
Settings.settingsValidMobileAlert: Those settings are valid for mobile alerts

ProfileSettings.passwordsMatch: Password and Confirm Password must be match.

SystemHealthSettings.requestTracing: Start the request tracing routine to generate a log file outlining all client app requests received by the server. This can be used to troubleshoot content delivery issues. Due to large file size, the trace stops automatically after 1 hour.
SystemHealthSettings.clientClashDumps: You've got several client crash dumps. Please, send this dumps from C:inetpub wwwroot 2b Innovations clientCrashDumps	osupport@2b Innovations.com Configure your SMTP server in 2b Innovations settings to g=have ability to send crash dumps in one click.
SystemHealthSettings.sendingAlertButton: Go to the page for receiving diagnostic information for sending alerts

Help.dashboardPageHelp: Dashboard is the page containing valuable statistics and shortcuts to the most used pieces of functionality represented as widgets.
Help.dashboardAddWidget: Widgets can be added by clicking the 'Add Widget' button in the top left corner of dashboard. By hovering your mouse over the widget tile you may see the short description of widget functionality.
Help.dashboardWidgetMinimizeOrClose: Once added,widget may or may not require entering the additional parameters. Widgets can also be minimizes or closed.
Help.addManyWidgetsToSlowDownThePage: Adding too many widgets to your Dashboard will slow down the page loading process.
Help.threeWidgetsAdded: By default, three widgets are added to the Dashboard of any user.
Help.activityMonitorDisplayDashboard: Activity monitor displays the real time statistics or users receiving the alerts. The activity level is usually somewhere about zero, until the messages are sent out to users.
Help.createAlertWidget: Create Alerts widget supplies a shortcut to the most used functionality of 2b Innovations creating desktop alerts. If you don't have the rights to do this widget will be unavailable to you
Help.calenderWidgetDashboard: The Calendar widget displays the content scheduled for the current month. In every date table cell  you may see some links. Clicking the Created link will lead you yo the list of content created on this day. Show Scheduled link will allow you to view the content scheduled for this specific date. If any of these links, or both of them, are not presented- it means that there is no contenct  created on.scheduled for this date.
Help.alertRecordVideoMessage: Click on the button and you can record video message from your webcam
Help.alertChooseVideo: Then click on the button and choose video from your computer after recording and saving video  from your webcam. You can also click here on the record button to record your video message.
Help.alertSelectBoderColor: Selecting skin affects appearance of your messages's title section and border color.
Help.alertMessagePriority: Usually skins are used for alerts differentiation depending on message priority.
Help.alertSkinSuitCompanyStyle: Some skins are available by default and additional can be ordered to better suit your company style.
Help.alertAllSkinsAreAvailable: You can view all available skins by clicking on the skin preview to the right of rich text editor on step One.
Help.alertTypes: On the top of your working area, there are three tabs representing three types of alerts:
Help.usualAlertTypes: Usual alert - simple message with any information you put in it.
Help.scrollingTickerAlertType: Scrolling ticker - Your message formatting will be truncated and alert will appear at the bottom of desktop in less obtrusive manner.
Help.rsvpAlertType: RSVP - like usual alert, but with possibility to add simple questions and receive feedback.
Help.alertUsingMessageTemplateDropdown: At the top right corner of your working area there is a dropdown list of available message  templates. When you choose one, alert title and content are automatically replaced by ones  specified in template. To manage such templates, see Message Templates section in the menu.
Help.createAlertTextEditor: Below the tabs you see the rich text editor to create alert. If you have enabled title styling  option,another editor will appear for title
Help.createAlertTextEditorFeatures: This editor has a wide range of features that allow you to format the text of your messages, insert smiles or images, and adjust background and text colors to suit your message. Hover your mouse over  each of the icons to learn what features it controls.
Help.createAlertTextEditorForUser: The wide range of features in this editor can tempt you to create an alert that is so complex and ornate that it is hard to read in the window in which alerts display on users' computers. Since the goal is to convey information, one or two formatting and decorative touches will usually be sufficient.
Help.alertAdditionalControls: Below the text editor there are additional controls:
Help.urgentAlerts: Urgent alert are urgent-they will appear on client's machine even if 2b Innovations client is disabled  Also they will always be positioned on top of any other alerts.
Help.acknowledgementAlertRequireReadingConfir: Acknowledgement alerts require reading confirmation - alerts of this type cannot be closed with default close&qout button and provide extended statistics.
Help.checkScheduleCheckboxToSendAlerts: If you want to send the alert at a particular time or create recurrence alert, check the Schedule  alert checkbox. Multiple schedule patterns are available.
Help.chooseAdjustingAlertType: To the right from this controls, you can choose alert type:
Help.desktopAlert: Desktop alert - selected by default, this will create Pop up window with specified size.
Help.emailAlert: E-mail alert (available if you have E-mail add-on installed)- send a copy of notification to you employee's e-mail.
Help.smsAlert: SMs alert (available if you have SMS add-on installed)- trucated copy of alert will be sent to your  employee's phone.
Help.blogPost: Blog post (available if you have Blog add-on installed)- post your alert contents to Wordpress-powered blog.
Help.buttons: At the bottom right, you can see a three buttons:
Help.previewButton: Preview button- by clicking this you can check how will you alert look on recipient's desktop.
Help.saveButton: Save button- Clicking this will save your alert to Draft section without sending it to anyone. You can choose recipients and send your message later.
Help.save&PreviewButton: Save & Next button- Clicking on it will send you to Step Two of Creating alerts- selecting  recipients.
Help.noHelpAboutThisPage: There is no help about this page.
Help.profileSettings: Profile setting page allow you to :
Help.profileAddEmail: Add e-mail or phone as additional contacts.
Help.saveButtonForProfile: Do not forget to click 'Save' button when you're finished, Otherwise, all changes will be discarded
Help.sentAlertHelp: This page usually contains list of all alerts which have been sent from control panel. You can specify how many records should be displayed in one page by clicking numbers above the table.
Help.sentAlertTableActions: For every alert in the table there are few actions which can be done:
Help.sentDuplicateAlert: Duplicate alert - use this if you want to send the same alert one more time, may be with some changes or to different recipients. Clicking this will send you to alert creation page with everything set as if you just composed it. List of recipients stay the same too, but you can change  everything you need.
Help.sentStop_StartScheduleAlert: Stop / Start scheduled alert. If you stop some scheduled alert, clients will not be receiving it until you click Start scheduled alert button, which appears instead of stop.
Help.sentPreviewAlert: Preview alert. Works pretty much the same as preview button in alerts editor. If you click this, alert will appear inside your browser page, enabling you to see how it will be looking on recipient display.
Help.sentDirectLink: Direct link. Clicking this will open pop-up window on the browser page containing a link  which you can send to anyone. If this person have an access to your server, they will see the page with alert preview on it.
Help.sentAlertReport: Alert report. This will bring up a basic report on the users who have been targeted with this message, who have received it and who have missed it.
Help.sentRescheduleAlert: Reschedule alert. Clicking this enables you to change schedule pattern or another parameters of  scheduled alert. Don't forget to hit Save button, or changes will be lost.
Help.sentAddAlertButtons: Add alert button will send you to alert editor. If you create alert, select recipients and hit  Send button, new alert record will appear on this page on top of the table. If in alert editor you click Save button instead of Save & Next, record will appear on Draft alerts page.
Help.sentDeleteButton: Checkboxes near every table row are for multiple alerts deleting. Just select all messages you want to permanently delete and click Delete button above the table
Help.sentUnobtrusiveOption: Type column is representing whether alert is unobtrusive, rsvp, ticker, fullscreen or usual (in this order). If alert is urgent, it has an effect on icon too. For example, if you have sent urgent  unobtrusive ticker, in the table it will be marked as urgent unobtrusive, because unobtrusive option priority is higher than ticker.
Help.draftAlertHelp: If you have saved an alert, but have not yet sent it, it will appear in the list of Drafts. You can specify how many records should be displayed in one page by clicking numbers above the table.
Help.draftAlertActionTypes: For every alert in the table there are few actions which can be done:
Help.draftSendAlert: Send alert - click this to send this draft. 2b Innovations will help you make sure you have identified  recipients for this message, and then will send it out. The message will move from the Drafts list  to Sent list
Help.draftEditAlert: Edit alert - click this to open the rich text editor and make further edits to this draft. You can then save it again or send it.
Help.draftPreviewAlert: Preview alert. Works pretty much the same as preview button in alerts editor. If you click this, alert will appear inside your browser page, enabling you to see how it will be looking on recipient display.
Help.draftDirectLink: Direct link. Clicking this will open pop-up window on the browser page containing a link which you  can send to anyone. If this person have an access to your server, they will see the page with alert preview on it.
Help.draftAddAlertButton: Add alert button will send you to alert editor. If you create alert, select recipients and hit Send button, new alert record will appear on Sent alerts on top of the table. If in alert editor you click Save & Next button instead of Save, record will appear on this page.
Help.messageTemplateHelp: Message templates are usually created to reduce the time of alert creation. You may add templates for different situations (staff reminder, system outage, etc).
Help.createMessageTemplateAddButton: To create a message template, click Add template button, enter alert title and contents, then click Save. You can use Preview button during alert composing or from the templates table to see what you've created.
Help.messageDropdownList: To create an alert using message template, you can use button in the Actions column. Another way is to use Alerts/Create as usually and select message template there using dropdown list.
Help.messageEdit&SaveTemplates: To edit message template, use corresponding button in the Actions column. This will enable you to change template name and contents. Don't forget to save your changes.
Help.messageDeleteButton: To delete one or more message templates, check corresponding boxes and click Delete button above or below the table.
Help.createSurveyHelp: While alerts are good at getting messages out to your team, surveys are excellent at getting the  responses you need to key questions.
Help.createSurveyRecipient: Each survey consists of questions and a series of answers that the recipient can choose from. You  may schedule your survey to be sent at appointed date and time as well as expired after end date.
Help.surveyInFewSteps: With our wizard you can easily create surveys in three steps
Help.surveyDewaTicker: There are four types of 2b Innovations surveys available for different situations:
Help.simpleSurvey: Simple Survey. This one is a sequence of questions with wide range of question types. Some of them may be answered with free text, some may have multiple answers, some may ask user if he wants to proceed with the questions or end survey. Answer statistics are available only for Control Panel  users.
Help.quizSurvey: Quiz. In this survey type, every answer option is marked by editor as correct or not. Answer statistics are available only for Control Panel users.
Help.pollSurvey: Poll. This is like a simple survey, but answer statistics are displayed to user after he is done with the questions.
Help.scheduleSurvey: To compose the survey, you should specify the name and questions. If you want to specify start and end dates for your survey, check Schedule survey box before creating questions
Help.surveyResizable: You`re able to change survey`s width and height. Make it resizable, change survey`s position on screen or make it fullscreen. Click on survey appearance section and set up options you need.
Help.previewSkin: You can view all available skins by clicking on the skin preview to the right of title editor.
Help.activeSurveyHelp: This list contains active surveys, which are accepting responses at the time. Survey moves to this list right after it was sent.
Help.activeActionAvailable: Available actions for every survey on the list are following:
Help.cloneSurvey: Clone survey. Creates the same survey with the same recipients list. You can change anything and then send survey again.
Help.viewSurveyResult: View survey results. Clicking this will open a new window with answer statistics for every question.  By clicking percentages near the bars, you can get a list of users selected specific option. Remember: surveys in this list are still active and statistics may change.
Help.stopSurvey: Stop survey. After you'll click this, survey will stop receiving answers and will be moved to Archived list.
Help.addButton: You can access survey creation wizard by clicking Add button.
Help.deleteButtonsInTable: To delete one or more surveys, check the boxes on the left of their table records and press Delete button above or below the table.
Help.archivedSurveyHelp: This list contains active surveys, which are accepting responses at the time. Survey moves to this list right after it was sent.
Help.createWallpaperHelp: Wallpaper Add-on allows you to use 2b Innovations to publish corporate desktop wallpapers. Corporate wallpaper is less intrusive but effective corporate communications channel. Communicate regarding upcoming changes or news, establish internal brand or publish product announcements right to the employee desktop wallpaper.
Help.user/GroupWallpaper: Publish your messages as corporate desktop wallpapers, use scheduling and sequence your wallpapers if you want 2 or more messages to rotate. All advanced targeting options including delivery to users/groups or any combination of those is supported.
Help.dewaSmartWallpaper: 2b Innovations wallpapers support such image formats as jpg, png, bmp and gif. Please ensure that picture you have selected have resolution high enough to fit user's screen. You may click Preview button to see how wallpapers will look on the user's desktop.
Help.wallpaperSaveButton: After selecting the image, click Save & Next button to proceed to selecting recipients. If you don't select recipients, wallpaper will be saved in Drafts list. Otherwise, after clicking the Send button it will appear in Current wallpapers list.
Help.wallpaperHelp: This page contains table with all current wallpapers.
Help.actionsAvialableInWallpaperList: There are following actions available for every wallpaper in the list:
Help.start/stopWallpaper: Start/Stop wallpaper. Stopping the wallpaper will prevent its appearing until you start it again. If no 2b Innovations wallpapers are active, user wallpaper will be restored.
Help.duplicateWallpaper: Duplicate wallpaper. After clicking this you will be sent to wallpaper editor and given possibility to change wallpaper image and/or list of recipients. After sending this changed wallpaper, a new item will appear in current wallpapers list. If you will not specify recipients, it will be saved in  drafts list.
Help.previousWallpaper: Preview wallpaper. This will open a new window to see how wallpaper looks on user's screen.
Help.wallpaperAddButton: Add wallpaper button will send you to wallpaper editor. If you create one, select recipients and hit Send button, new record will appear on Current wallpaper page on top of the table. If wallpaper creating process will not be completed, record will appear in Drafts list.
Help.wallpaperDeleteButton: Checkboxes near every table row are for multiple wallpapers deleting. Just select all items you want to permanently delete and click Delete button above the table
Help.draftWallpaper: This page contains table with all draft wallpapers.
Help.sendWallpaper: Send wallpaper. Clicking this will send you to Select Recipients step of wallpaper creating. After  choosing recipients, click the Send button and wallpaper will move from the Draft list to Current list.
Help.editWallpaper: Edit wallpaper. Clicking this will send you to first step of wallpaper creating, allowing you to make changes before selecting recipients and sending wallpaper.
Help.emergencyAlertHelp: Click on the button and you can record video message from your webcam
Help.videoRecordButton: Then click on the button and choose video from your computer after recording and saving video from your webcam. You can also click here on the record button to record button to record your video message.
Help.instantMessages: Instant messages are the quickest way to send pre-defined content. Unlike the message templates and  alert drafts, these messages already have lists of recipients and can be sent in one click. To get the emergency alert id for API, hover your mouse over the alert title.
Help.emergencyColorCodes: Inspired by the various hospitals emergency codes systems, 2b Innovations emergency notifications module  allows you to create your own color codes system or to input an existing one.
Help.createEmergencyColorCodes: Create the color codes for all kinds of situations. You'll be able to specify the code during the creation of Instant Send message.
Help.instantSendMessageColorCodes: When the Instant Send message is created using the color code, the tile, which is used for sending  the message out, will have a distinctive color, saving the sender a few extra seconds when he needs to inform the workforce.
Help.screensaverHelp: Corporate screensaver is one of the less intrusive but powerful ways to communicate with desktops of your employees. 2b Innovations screensaver work same way as ordinary PC screensaver and allows for targeted content delivery.
Help.creatingScreensaverViaDewaSmartTicker: 2b Innovations provides you three ways of creating screensavers:
Help.importingFromPowerpoint: Importing from PowerPoint. To use MS PowerPoint presentation as screensaver, you need to save it as .wmv file and upload it to control panel. If you choose this way, 2b Innovations will give you step-by-step instructions and video manual if needed.
Help.imageUseAsScreensaver: Using image as screensaver. This is the easiest way, you just need to upload high resolution image in one of the accepted formats (jpg, png, bmp or gif). Image will be scaled to fit each user's screen.
Help.htmlScreensaver: Creating HTML screensaver. In this case, you'll be able to create screensaver with our built-in  WYSIWYG editor, just like usual alerts. These screensavers may contain images, text, clickable links, FLASH, video and even more.
Help.contentSource: This step depending on your choice of content source:
Help.screensaverCreatingForPowerPoint: If you're creating screensaver from PowerPoint presentation, follow the instructions to create video file and upload it in control panel.
Help.selectImage&Upload: If you're creating screensaver from image, just select image and upload it.
Help.createHtmlScreensaver: If you're decided to create your own HTML screensaver, feel free to use wide selection of tools in our editor to create screensaver that suits your need the best.
Help.previewButtonScreensaver: Also you need to specify screensaver name. After done all of the above click Preview button to  see how your screensaver will look like.
Help.screensaverOptions: It may be useful to visit options tab where you can specify displaying time, which means a lot if you're sending multiple screensavers to one user.
Help.screensaverSave&NextButton: When you're done with screensaver creation, click save & Next button to select recipients and send screensaver. If you won't select recipients, screensaver will be saved automatically in the Drafts list.
Help.screensaverDewaSmartTicker: 2b Innovations screensavers, just like every other types of messages, can be broadcasted, sent to specific users or to selected IP Groups.
Help.screensaverSendButton: After you click send button screensaver will be available from the Current screensavers menu section.
Help.currentScreensaver: This page contains table with all current screensavers.
Help.actionsAvialableInScreensaverList: There are following actions available for every screensaver in the list:
Help.start/StopScreensaver: Start/Stop screensaver. Stopping the screensaver will prevent its appearing until you start it again.
Help.duplicateScreensaver: Duplicate screensaver. After clicking this you will be sent to screensaver editor and given possibility to change contents and/or list of recipients. After sending this changed screensaver, a new item will appear in current screensavers list. If you will not specify recipients, it will be saved in drafts list.
Help.previewScreensaver: Preview screensaver. This will open a new window to see how screensaver looks on user's screen
Help.addScreensaver: Add screensaver button will send you to screensaver editor. If you create one, select recipients and hit Send button, new record will appear on Current screensavers page on top of the table. If screensaver creating process will not be completed, record will appear in Drafts list.
Help.deleteButtonInScreensaver: Checkboxes near every table row are for multiple screensavers deleting. just select all items you  want to permanently delete and click delete button
Help.domainsHelp: This page contains list of all created domains
Help.domainsAddedTool: Self-Registered users domain is presented here by default, more domains can be added using synchronization tool.
Help.toLearnMoreClickSynchronizationButton: To learn more about it, click synchronization button and follow 2b Innovations Help tips.
Help.synchronizationPageHelp: This page contains a list of all created synchronizations with Active Directory / Novell eDirectory. Such synchronizations used for keeping your 2b Innovations users list relevant. To add a synchronization  to the list, click on add synchronization button.
Help.synchronizationIcons: To start specific synchronization manually, click on corresponding icon in the table record. Usually, synchronization is a scheduled task which run automatically. To specify this schedule, click icon for synchronization editing, check there auto-synchronization option and choose whatever schedule pattern you need.
Help.organization/AudienceHelpPage: Organization page provides you a quick access to information about all the available domains in  tree-structure form. From here, you can add users and create groups from them. New domains are created by synchronizations with Actice Directory or eDirectory if you have installed a  corresponding add-on. You also can search for user, group or computer by name.
Help.objectsAvialable: There are three object types available from the dropdown list at the top left.
Help.organizationUsers: Users. Shows you every user in organization. For every users some actions are available, such as viewing user details, editing his information or deleting him from the organization.
Help.organizationGroups: Groups. Some groups are created by synchronization process, some can be added by you from this page. For each group, table shows number of users in it, along with registered computers, child and parent  groups. By clicking digit links you can see full list of them. For every group available actions are editing and deleting.
Help.organizationComputers: Computers. This shows the list of registered in 2b Innovations database computers, with only action to view computer details.
Help.addUser: To add user or group, click buttons on the top right of your working area. 2b Innovations will guide you through a simple forms and make sure that you fill all the required fields
Help.publisherDewaSmartEditor: 2b Innovations Editor is a person who manage user groups that will receive messages; design the message  templates; create, send and track alerts and surveys.
Help.newEditorPolicies: Before creating a new editor, make sure you have an appropriate policy created for him. To learn more about policies, go to Policies menu section.
Help.addEditor/Publisher: To add an editor to the list, click add editor/publisher button, choose login and password for editor, select policy from dropdown list and click add button.
Help.editorEditIcon: You can access editor editing screen by pressing corresponding icon in Actions column. Here you can change his name, policy or password.
Help.editorDeleteButton: Do delete one or more editor records from the table, check corresponding boxes and press Delete button above or below the table.
Help.policiesHelpPage: Policy is a Control Panel User's scope of activity.
Help.addPolicyButton: To create a new policy, click on the add policy button.
Help.editPolicyDuplicateButton: If you want to edit some policy, click corresponding icon in the Actions column. If you want to have old policy saved, click Duplicate button first and then edit copy, which appeared in the table.
Help.deletePoliciesButton: To delete one or more policies, check corresponding boxes in the table and click Delete button above or below the table.
Help.ipGroupHelpPage: This page contains list of every created custom IP group. You can use search field to find them by name.
Help.ipGroupSelectUser: IP groups is another way of selecting users for alerts sending, working for every registration type, like self-registering or Active Directory synchronization.
Help.ipGroupSelectUserRecipient: To send alert or another piece of content to users in specific IP group, select IP groups option from dropdown menu at selecting recipients step.
Help.ipGroupAddButton: To add new IP Group to list, press Add group button.
Help.ipgroupActions: There are following actions available for every IP group in the list:
Help.ipgroupEdit: Edit IP group. This enables you to add, change or delete objects included in specific group.
Help.ipgroupView: View IP group. This action isn't displayed in the Actions column and can be done by clicking IP group title. This will open a new window with list of all objects included in the group
Help.ipgroupDeleteButton: To delete one or more IP groups you should check boxes at the left of corresponding table records and click delete button above or below the table.
Help.videoAlertHelpPAge: Video alerts are a type of desktop pop-ups built around video content. On this page, you will find an interface that enables you to quickly build a notifications using a video file on your machine,  video uploaded by different users, or an external video, such as ones on YouTube
Help.videoAlert: First of all, you need to determine which video source you're going to use. If you have a video on your machine, you can drag and drop it into a highlighted area on the first tab of this page. It  will take some time for it to upload - you will be notified when the process is over. You can also use videos uploaded by different 2b Innovations publishers by picking them from the list on the right.
Help.internetVideoAlert: If you want to use an Internet video, like from YouTube, you need to find a Share/Embed section on a   page where it is located, then copy the embed code and paste it into the corresponding field on the   second tab of this page. Notice that your end users should have unrestricted Internet connection to view this video.
Help.videoTailoringPreviewButton: Before you send out your video alert, it is recommended for you to use a Preview button (Hotkey:  Alt+P) to view how it will look like on user's side. You might need to tweak the message  width/height so it will appear without the scrollbars. You can also supply an optional text description which will be displayed above the video player in a final notification.
Help.videoListHelpPage: This page contains list of all video alerts which have been sent from control panel. You can specify  how many records should be displayed in one page by clicking numbers above the table.
Help.recordsDisplayed: This page usually contains list of all alerts which have been sent from control panel. You can specify how many records should be displayed in one page by clicking numbers above the table.
Help.draftScreensaver: This page contains table with all draft screensavers.
Help.sendScreensaver: Send screensaver. Clicking this will send you to Select Recipients step of screensaver creating. After choosing recipients, click the Send button and screensaver will move from the Draft list to Current list.
Help.editScreensaver: Edit screensaver. Clicking this will send you to first step of screensaver creating, allowing you to make changes before selecting recipients and sending screensaver.
Help.deleteScreensaverButton: Checkboxes near every table row are for multiple screensavers deleting. Just select all items you want to permanently delete. click delete button above the table
Help.recipientSelectPage: This is the page for selecting recipients for the content you just created. Drop-down menu suggests you three ways:
Help.messageBroadcasting: Broadcasting the message. In this case, content will be received by every user in your organization.
Help.recipientSelectingOption: Selecting recipients. Choosing this option will enable you to pick specific users and groups from organization.
Help.ipGroupSelect: Selecting IP Groups. To create such groups, see IP Groups item in menu.
Help.clickSendButton: After you done with choosing recipients, hit Send button.
